section.title: Deliberate Practice: Point-Slope Form
section.p: Algebra is a skill, which means it requires practice to become proficient. But it will take more than rote repetition to get there. Deliberate practice is the thoughtful repetition of a task. For each of these sections, you will be given a list of specific skills or ideas to focus on as you practice thinking through the problems.

worksheet.p: Instructions: Find a point-slope form of the line that meets the specified conditions, then rewrite it in slope-intercept form.

exercise.p: The line that passes through the point (2,-1) with slope \frac{1}{3}.
The line that passes through the point (-1,2) with slope \frac{3}{2}.
The line that passes through the point (3,0) with slope -3.
The line that passes through the points (2,4) and (-1,-1).
The line that passes through the points (1,-2) and (3,2).
The line that passes through the points (0,3) and (2,0).
The line that passes through the point (-1, -2) that is parallel to y = - \frac{1}{2} x + 4
The line that passes through the point (-1, -2) that is parallel to y = \frac{2}{3} x - 1
The line that passes through the point (2, -3) that is parallel to y + 2 = \frac{5}{2} (x - 2)
The line that passes through the point (2, -3) that is parallel to y - 1 = -2(x + 3)
